subject: Re: [junit] which jdk will work with JUnit on Redhat6.2?
msgSnippet: on 1/19/01 4:55 PM, Peter Bismuti at peterb@pssg.com wrote: Oops, here is the output again: FAILURES!!! Test Results: Run: 78 Failures: 2 Errors: 1 JUnit 3.5
messageBody:
Re: [junit] which jdk will work with JUnit on Redhat6.2? on 1/19/01 4:55 PM, Peter Bismuti at peterb@... wrote:

Oops, here is the output again:

FAILURES!!!
Test Results:
Run: 78 Failures: 2 Errors: 1

JUnit 3.5 was (very) recently released, and it looks like its tests take problems with process return values into account.  This should clear up the two failures.

I'm not so sure about the other one, but I think that I was seeing similar things here.  Is the .class file that the test is looking for, junit/tests/ClassLoaderTest.class, on your classpath somewhere?  If you're running from the jar (does it include tests?), I imagine that it would be, but if you built the tests by hand, especially by building AllTests and just letting the dependencies sort out, it might not be.  I'm not sure that the class is explicitly referenced anywhere in the source, and might need to be built on its own.

Hope this helps,
Ben Schroeder
schroeder@...
